newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean gov't to drop out of joint aircraft firm.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean gov't to drop out of joint aircraft firm.

text.p: The South Korean government has decided to drop out of the proposed joint aircraft company involving four domestic aircraft makers, officials at the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy said on Tuesday.
"We have decided not to take part in setting up a joint aircraft firm after consulting with the finance ministry," said an official in the trade ministry's aerospace division.
"There were several reasons why the government would want to participate, including acting as a mediator and overseeing efficient adoption of advanced technology," he said.
"However, the plan would conflict with our industrial policy of privatisation and guaranteeing autonomy," he said.

The plan to set up the joint firm was proposed last month by four aircraft makers, Samsung Aerospace Industries Ltd, Hyundai Space and Aircraft Co, Korean Airlines Co Ltd and Daewoo Heavy Industries Co.
